author: Amanda Harding
description: On July 4th, the movie “Sinners” will become the first show to be interpreted into “Black American Sign Language (BASL),” per a press release from Warner Bros. The entertainment company described it as “a major step forward in accessibility, representation, and visibility in streaming.” “BASL is a distinct dialect of American Sign Language (ASL) with ...
title: ‘Sinners’ To Debut On Max As First Show With ‘Black American Sign Language’ Translation

author: Sam Korkus
description: The Senate voted Tuesday to pass the “One Big Beautiful Bill,” bringing President Donald Trump’s chief legislative package one step closer to the finish line. The bill, which the House of Representatives passed in May, underwent some changes in the Upper Chamber. The bill now returns to the House, which will either pass the amended ...
title: Here Are The Major Things The Senate Changed In The Big, Beautiful Bill

author: Hank Berrien
description: In January 2024, Claire Shipman, who served as the chair of Columbia University’s board of trustees before she became the acting president of Columbia University, minimized the open antisemitism at the university, tried to keep a pro-Israel member of the board unaware of the school’s negotiations with anti-Israel demonstrators, and tried to remove that member ...
title: Columbia University Prez Wanted To Replace Jewish Board Member With Arab, Agreed Jew Was A ‘Mole’

author: Leif Le Mahieu
description: Two Chinese nationals were arrested for allegedly working on behalf of a Chinese intelligence agency to recruit members of the United States military to betray America, the Justice Department announced. The Justice Department said Tuesday that the FBI on June 27 had arrested 38-year-old Yuance Chen, a Chinese national who has legal permanent residency in ...
title: Chinese Nationals Arrested Over Plot To Recruit American Military Personnel

author: Tim Pearce
description: The Trump administration has officially shuttered the United States Agency for International Development after rolling its operations into the State Department. Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced the end of the independent agency on Tuesday. Rubio said USAID funds would be better managed and more effective under State Department oversight than they have been in ...
title: Rubio: USAID Closed After Decades Of Funding Posh Lifestyles Of ‘Countless’ NGO Execs

author: Ben Shapiro
description: The Scavengers are on the move.  Scavengers are people who wish to tear down the society in which they live. They have very little in common with one another other than that simple fact. They simply want to tear down everything. That explains the bizarre agglomeration of radicals from across the political spectrum, who seem ...
title: The Scavengers Are On The Move

author: Mary Margaret Olohan and Mairead Elordi
description: WASHINGTON—The White House has struck a deal with the University of Pennsylvania that requires the school to strip trans-identifying male swimmer Lia Thomas of the titles he won on the women’s team, The Daily Wire has learned. The University of Pennsylvania will restore all titles to female athletes that were “misappropriated” by male athletes, according ...
title: UPenn Agrees To Strip Medals From Lia Thomas As Part Of Sweeping White House Deal

author: Daily Wire Shop
description: The following excerpt is taken from “Lions and Scavengers: The True Story of America (and Her Critics),” by Ben Shapiro (Threshold Editions/Simon & Schuster, September 2, 2025) * * * CHAPTER ONE: THE WAY OF THE LION Rome, Italy   You can feel the ghosts. And they stir. Italy is one of the most beautiful countries ...
title: Read The Entire First Chapter Of Ben Shapiro’s Upcoming Book: ‘Lions And Scavengers’

author: Virginia Kruta
description: Despite an early hiccup in the deliberation process, a federal jury has apparently reached a verdict on four of the five counts against disgraced rapper and music mogul Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs. The jury sent a note to Manhattan Federal Court Judge Arun Subramanian on Tuesday, stating that they had reached a verdict on counts 2, ...
title: Jury Reaches Partial Verdict In ‘Diddy’ Sex Trafficking Trial, One Charge Still Pending

author: Virginia Kruta
description: The United States Air Force and Space Force announced that they had smashed through their 2025 recruiting goals three months ahead of schedule — following similar reports from both the Army and the Navy several weeks earlier. Air Force Chief of Staff General David Allvin shared the news in a post on X, saying, “People ...
title: Air Force And Space Force Smash Recruiting Goals Three Months Early: ‘Lining Up And Signing Up!’

author: Isabel Garcia
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem on Tuesday shared a disturbing tale of an illegal immigrant, which she said underscored the importance of the Trump administration’s deportation efforts. “The other day I was talking to some marshals who had been partnering with ICE,” Noem said. “They said they had detained a cannibal and put him on ...
title: Illegal Immigrant Cannibal Tried To Eat Himself On Deportation Flight, DHS Secretary Says

author: Mairead Elordi
description: In 2023, the Teamsters signed a massive deal with UPS to guarantee a fleet of air-conditioned trucks. “Our members just ratified the most lucrative agreement the Teamsters have ever negotiated at UPS. This contract will improve the lives of hundreds of thousands of workers,” Teamsters General President Sean M. O’Brien boasted at the time. “Teamsters ...
title: UPS Push For Electric Trucks Leaves Drivers Sweating — And Unions Furious

author: Virginia Kruta
description: Parents are fighting back after their three young three children were expelled from the Nysmith School for the Gifted after they raised concerns about antisemitic bullying and harassment — about which the headmaster and owner of the school, Kenneth R. Nysmith, allegedly did nothing. Parents Brian Vazquez and Ashok Roy filed a lawsuit with the ...
title: Virginia School Under Fire For Expelling Kids Who Objected To Antisemitic Bullying

author: Spencer Lindquist
description: The Trump administration’s Department of Justice (DOJ) issued a memo directing United States’ attorneys to “prioritize” and “pursue” denaturalization proceedings for new citizens who may pose a threat to national security. The memo, issued by Assistant Attorney General Brett Shumate to the Justice Department’s Civil Division on June 11, directs lawyers to “prioritize and maximally ...
title: Trump Admin Orders Justice Dept To Denaturalize New Citizens Convicted Of Crimes

author: Amanda Harding
description: Notorious leftist Rosie O’Donnell, who recently left the country due to Trump being elected president, is coming after Oprah for attending the lavish wedding of Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez. The comedian stated her complaints as part of an Instagram post. “The Bezos’ wedding. It turned my stomach seeing all these billionaires gathering in the ...
title: Rosie O’Donnell Calls Out Oprah For Attending Bezos Wedding: ‘Turned My Stomach’

author: Hank Berrien
description: As Israelis have tried to return to normalcy after weeks of sirens forcing them into shelters in the middle of the night, on Tuesday night in Israel, sirens again went off as the Houthis in Yemen, proxies for the despotic regime in Iran, fired another missile at Israel that was intercepted, despite the ceasefire agreed ...
title: Israel Thwarts Latest Houthi Attack As Iranian-Backed Missiles Keep Coming

author: Virginia Kruta
description: President Donald Trump suggested that he’d be willing to take action if New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani ever moved to block Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents from doing their jobs: “Well just have to arrest him.” Trump addressed the issue while touring “Alligator Alcatraz,” a facility in the Florida Everglades that is ...
title: ‘We’ll Have To Arrest Him’: Trump Threatens Action If Zohran Mamdani Tries To Block ICE

author: Jayden Jelso
description: Stephen Ireland, who has repeatedly attacked J.K. Rowling online for her pro-woman and anti-trans stances, was sentenced to 30 years in prison on Monday for raping a 12-year-old boy. Ireland co-founded the pro-LGBT UK-based group Surrey Pride in 2018, and since then, has used his position to lash out at the “Harry Potter” author, labeling ...
title: Pride Group Founder Who Vilified J.K. Rowling For Defending Women Convicted Of Child Rape

author: Hank Berrien
description: Assistant Attorney General for the Civil Rights Division Harmeet Dhillon issued a blanket condemnation of universities across the country, averring that virtually none of them have acted in accordance with federal law regarding non-discrimination in admissions. Dhillon and her law firm joined the Alliance Defending Freedom to represent The Daily Wire when it became the first ...
title: DOJ Warns: Almost All U.S. Universities Are Breaking Federal Anti-Discrimination Laws

author: Virginia Kruta
description: Disney-Pixar’s latest box office bomb “Elio” was supposed to be even worse, according to a report published Monday by The Hollywood Reporter — but a number of elements were cut after a screening of the film went nowhere with the audience. The movie’s titular character was originally written as “queer-coded” — a nod to the ...
title: Pixar Bomb ‘Elio’ Was Supposed To Be Super Gay, Only Changed After Dismal Screening

author: Amanda Harding
description: After his five-year-old daughter fell overboard, a father dove off a Disney Dream cruise ship in a dramatic rescue, officials said. The four-night cruise was returning to Fort Lauderdale on Sunday after making a trip to Disney’s Lookout Cay at Lighthouse Point in the Bahamas.  The father’s name has not been publicly released, but passenger ...
title: Hero Dad Leaps From Disney Cruise To Save Daughter In Daring Ocean Rescue

author: Elie Feder and Aaron Zimmer
description: The intelligentsia is always telling us to “follow the science.” But what happens when “the science” starts undermining academia’s deeply-held beliefs? Suddenly, the definition of science changes — or we’re told we misunderstood it all along. If you’ve followed the debates over climate change or gender ideology, this story might sound familiar. But what may ...
title: The Multiverse Scandal: How Academia Is Redefining Science To Avoid God

author: Hank Berrien
description: Critics of the United Nations have slammed the international organization for hindering the work of the Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), which has reportedly donated more than 50 million meals to Gazan residents. U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres claimed on Friday that the GHF in Gaza is “inherently unsafe” and “killing people.” “Guterres said U.N.-led humanitarian efforts ...
title: ‘We’ll Break Your Legs’: U.N. Accused Of ‘Mafia-Type’ Response To U.S.-Led Gaza Relief Efforts

author: Daniel Chaitin
description: President Donald Trump scored another major legislative victory on Tuesday with the GOP-led Senate narrowly passing “One Big, Beautiful Bill” with the help of Vice President JD Vance, keeping alive the prospect of Congress getting the centerpiece measure to his desk by Independence Day. The 800-page-plus bill, which aims to fulfill many of Trump’s spending ...
title: Trump Scores Major Victory As Vance Helps Push ‘Big, Beautiful Bill’ Through Senate

author: Mary Margaret Olohan
description: WASHINGTON—President Donald Trump raised eyebrows Tuesday by suggesting that he could have the Department of Government Efficiency look into Elon Musk, and entertaining a question about deporting the high-profile businessman. “DOGE is the monster that might have to go back and eat Elon,” the president said outside the White House on Tuesday as he prepared ...
title: Trump: ‘DOGE Is The Monster That Might Have To Go Back And Eat Elon’

author: Leif Le Mahieu
description: President Donald Trump urged the Senate to get his “One Big, Beautiful Bill” over the finish line as a few Republican senators appear to be holding out.  Speaking to reporters on Tuesday morning, Trump said he was confident that the bill, which provides funding for border security and makes his 2017 tax cuts permanent, would ...
title: Trump Rallies Republicans To Back ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ And Seize Defining Legislative Moment

author: Morning Wire
description: The DOJ cracks down on “sanctuary city” Los Angeles, Trump continues his feud with Jerome Powell, and Harvard and Democrats try to slow Trump’s budget bill as the clock ticks down on the president’s self-imposed July 4 deadline. It’s Tuesday, July 1, and this is the news you need to know to start your day. ...
title: Morning Brief: Trump Sues Los Angeles, Battles Harvard, And Pushes Big Beautiful Bill

author: Spencer Lindquist
description: President Donald Trump is set to visit Florida’s newest illegal alien detention facility — dubbed “Alligator Alcatraz” — later today. Officials say the site will not only increase the federal government’s holding capacity, but also provide ICE with a detention facility that is nearly impossible to break out of. Construction began on the location, an ...
title: Why It Might Be Impossible For Illegals To Escape Florida’s ‘Alligator Alcatraz’
